QuestionItems.question: Describe the patient's endocrine system.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient is an unstable insulin-dependent diabetic who is on a sliding scale of 60 units in the morning, 50 units in the afternoon and 40 units at night of Humulin.
Caregiver reports it is not uncommon for her to have over 500 blood sugar readings. Primary care is aware.
Patient was hyperglycemic at 376. Random caregivers gave 60 units of insulin but declined need for intervention. Education provided on hyperglycemia.
Patient also has hypothyroidism.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the patient's immune system and blood health.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient denies having any immunodeficiencies or symptoms of infection. No unusual bleeding or bruising.
Patient has not received any transfusions or dialysis.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the patient's cardiovascular health.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient does have pitting edema 2+ to both lower extremities, history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, states she has prior MI.
Currently receiving Unna boots to both lower extremities.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the patient's respiratory health.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient's lungs clear to auscultation times five. Caregiver states they did have oxygen in the home, but that he has returned it because there was no need for it. They deny that there are any respiratory issues.
Patient denies having any cough or shortness of breath at rest. Patient does state shortness of breath with moderate exertion.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the patient's nose, mouth, throat, and sinuses.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient does not wear any dentures. Denies having any kind of congestion, no ENT problems, no swallowing difficulty.
No corrective devices.

Her hearing moderate impairment, a skilled nurse has to raise voice. No hearing aids present.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the patient's nutritional health and hydration status
LLMSummarizedText: Patient is an insulin-dependent diabetic. No sugar added. Cardiac diet.

She is properly hydrated. States she drinks six to eight glasses of water a day. Limitations to nutrition and hydration would include that she requires someone to assist her to pivot into her motorized wheelchair and able to be able to feed herself and obtain water.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the goals and discharge plan for this patient.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient stated goal is to get wounds healed.
Goal for this patient would be to get wounds healed and um strengthening, education on insulin-dependent diabetes, and to see blood sugar readings under 300.
Prognosis and rehab potential for this patient is fair.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the interventions needed by the patient.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient is an insulin-dependent diabetic. We will require weekly three times weekly fingerstick glucose monitoring.
Patient requires Unna boots and wound care as described: cleaning of the skin with sterile normal saline, applying calcium alginate over open areas.
Wound care measurements and photos weekly.
Patient's legs are to be wrapped with Unna boots over the calcium alginate, then covered with RhoGAs and then covered with Prolixin tape for closure.
Patient is currently being managed by Integrous wound care clinic also.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the patient's ability to prepare and take their medications reliably and safely.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient's caregiver daughter provides all medication administration as far as sitting up pill planner. Husband assists with dialing the quick pen on the insulin.
Patient is able to inject insulin herself, but needs it to be prepared and oral medication to be prepared with reminders.

QuestionItems.question: Describe the patient's active diagnoses
LLMSummarizedText: Patient and patient's caregiver described that she has chronic venous stasis ulcers that they have been treating for quite some time. Patient requires care. She has pitting edema 2+ bilaterally, both legs, scattered blistering on both lower extremities and four open wounds to leg.

Wound one measuring 2x1.5x0.1, round with moderate serous fluid. Wound number two measures 1x2x0, irregular in shape, moderate serous fluid. Wound number three measures 3x5x0, round with moderate serous drainage. Wound four measures 1.5x1x0 with moderate serous fluid.

Patient was found to have left leg wrapped upon arrival with a tiny hose stuck to the leg. Patient will continue to require skilled nursing three times weekly. Education was provided on the need to leave dressing in place due to the risk of worsening the condition if the bandage is taken off. The hose was stuck to the patient's leg related to the drainage.
Patient stated that the hose was removed by the caregiver due to pain. Continued education and monitoring will be needed related to compliance on dressing.

QuestionItems.question: Describe your plan of care for this patient.
LLMSummarizedText: Patient will require physical therapy evaluation.
Patient should receive evaluation from skilled nurse three times weekly.
Wound care supplies are going to include sterile normal saline, 4x4 gauze, Unna boots, calcium AG, Kerlix, and tape.

Um granulation tissue um pink, dull, dusky, um moderate to significant drainage noted.
